issue.title: Release Mockito 2.0

repository.name: mockito
repository.description: Most popular Mocking framework for unit tests written in Java

issue.body:
Incompatible changes:
- [x] stop producing mockito-all #153
- [x] stop depending on hamcrest internally #154
- [x] use newer hamcrest #232
- [x] make the anyXxx and any(Xxx) matchers intuitive #134, #194
- ~~fix the site links~~
- [x] push cglib mockmaker to a separate jar #248
- [x] stop using ant for producing OSGi bundles. No more ant in the build #249
- [x] remove jars from source distribution #250
- ~~perhaps introduce is() matcher~~ #246
- ~~richer and smarter stubbing~~ #303
- ~~support java8 features for capturing arguments and matchers~~
- [x] make the JUnitRule and the runner verbose
- [x] ensure release notes can be neatly generated for the RC #582

Possibly compatible (and hence, could be released pre-2.0 if needed)
- [x] drop deprecated code
- [x] unincubate API
- ~~drop serialVersionUID~~

body: Powermock still depends on `CglibMockMaker`, so users how want use Powermock with Mockito need this Jar in Maven repository. Are you going to put it in Maven Central?
Powermock needs to update at some point but as I understand it, the cglib mock maker will be published as a seperate artifcat.

Powermock already has some internal mockito classes repackaged, maybe @johanhaleby could be interested to have all the cglib mockmaker repackaged on the Powermock side until it is updated to work with Mockito and ByteBuddy.
Yeah, I think that would probably be the easiest way forward. I personally won't have time to port powermock to non cglib in the near future.

issue.title: Powermock & Mockito 2

repository.name: powermock
repository.description: PowerMock is a Java framework that allows you to unit test code normally regarded as untestable.

issue.body:
As it was discussed in ML Mockito has been moved from Cglib to ByteBuddy. More important that since release 2.0.32-beta cglib classes have been moved out into  separated jar [Mockito#248](https://github.com/mockito/mockito/issues/248).

But PowerMock still depends on classes which have been moved, so users of Powermock get java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError. 

In release 1.6.2 Mockito classes was copied into PowerMock, but not all. To continue support newer version of Mockito: 
- Repack [mockito-cglib](https://github.com/mockito/mockito-cglib) into Powermock mockito-api. I think new module should be created, like mockito2-api
- Next step migrate mockito2-api to ByteBuddy. 

I'm going to create a pull request with repacked mockito-cglib soon.

issue.title: Add support Mockito-2.0. Repacked cglib.

repository.name: powermock
repository.description: PowerMock is a Java framework that allows you to unit test code normally regarded as untestable.

issue.body:
Fix #613

As was suggested in [Mockito#248](https://github.com/mockito/mockito/issues/248) I've repacked mockito-cglib into Powermock via creating a new module `powermock-api-mockito2`. Really, I did nothing, except copying `powermock-api-mockito`, putting `mockito-cglib` class into powermock and update build. 

Ahh, of course I had to update `org.powermock.api.mockito.PowerMockito` to support API changes in the `org.mockito.Mockito`class. 
Same true for `org.powermock.api.mockito.internal.mockmaker.PowerMockMaker`.

@bric3 and @raphw, could also review changes, please?

I've added new Maven profile: mockito2. So nothing has been changed for users of Mockito 1 and nothing has been changed in build. But if run build with profile `mockito2` then several new artefacts will be built. And these artefact could be used by Mockito 2 users. All tests are passed for Mockito 2 build. Also I've checked new artefact with several other open source projects which use Powermock, and they tests have also have been passed.
